wikipedia_page.main: Nusrat Munir Ul-Ghani (born 1 September 1972) is a British Conservative Party politician who has served as the Member of Parliament (MP) for Wealden in East Sussex since 2015. She previously served as Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State at the Department for Transport and Lord Commissioner of HM Treasury.

response: Wealden is a constituency represented in the House of Commons of the UK Parliament since 2015 by Nus Ghani, a Conservative. Ghani was the first Muslim woman to be elected as a Conservative member of Parliament.

link_mentions.page: List of Parliamentary constituencies in East Sussex

response: The UK Parliament constituency for Buxted is Wealden. The conservative Nus Ghani was elected in the May 2015 election.

Hellingly is a ward in the Wealden parliamentary constituency, the MP since 2015 is Nus Ghani, Conservative. There are fourteen parish councillors on Hellingly Parish Council. The population of this ward at the 2011 census was 5,940.
The Member of Parliament for Wealden is the Conservative Nus Ghani. She was elected in 2015 with a majority of 22,967.

link_mentions.page: List of Lords Commissioners of the Treasury

response: In October 2020, Nus Ghani was announced as a non-executive director of the firm, which promised to "revolutionise the future of maritime transport" by winning "the multi-million pound UK government innovation grant... to develop zero-emission ferries in Belfast".
